books.title: Bulldog Drummond
books.author: H. C. McNeile
books.summary: A demobilized officer places a newspaper advert for adventure, and its response leads him to discover a conspiracy.

books.title: When the World Shook
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A writer of adventure stories indulges in a sudden urge to travel to the islands of the Pacific, and soon finds himself shipwrecked on a remote South Sea island.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Mystery of Cabin Island
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: A group of amateur detectives unravel the mystery of a missing stamps collection.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Ajax
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A great warrior descends into madness after being denied magical armor.

books.title: Phantastes
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A young man awakes in Fairy Land, where he takes part in a series of strange adventures.

books.title: The Bridal Wreath
books.author: Sigrid Undset
books.summary: In 14th-century Norway, a nobleman’s daughter grows up and faces passion, sin, and filial piety.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: The Insidious Dr. Fu-Manchu
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: An intrepid detective hunts the criminal mastermind Fu-Manchu through early 20th-century London.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Georgia Douglas Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by Georgia Douglas Johnson.

books.title: Northanger Abbey
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A young girl with an overactive imagination comes of age.

books.title: The Inheritors
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A young writer dabbling in journalism meets a strange, otherworldly woman with long-term political goals.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.
